article.headline: Bucknell 59, Army 47
article.story: LEWISBURG, Pa. (AP) -- Chris McNaughton had 14 points and Abe Badmus added eight assists and five steals as Bucknell beat a pesky Army team 59-47 Friday night in the first round of the Patriot League Tournament. The top-seeded Bison (24-4, 15-0 Patriot League) will play American, which earlier in the day beat Lafayette 75-62, in Sunday's semifinal. Bucknell also got 13 points from Kevin Bettencourt and Charles Lee scored 12 and had seven rebounds. Matt Bell led eighth-seeded Army (5-22, 1-14) with 13 points and Jarell Brown added 10. Bucknell needed a late 14-0 run to break away from the Black Knights, who closed to 41-37 with 10:04 left on Bell's 18-foot jumper from the top of the key. On the ensuing possession, Bettencourt hit a jumper as he was fouled, then hit the free throw. As the Black Knights went almost seven minutes down the stretch without a field goal, Bucknell got seven points from Lee and a steal and assist from Badmus to put the game away. Lee's tip-in of a missed breakaway layup made the score 55-37 with 3:41 left. The Bison trailed for most of the first half before Bell left with 3:41 remaining with his third foul. Bucknell closed out the half on an 11-2 run to take a 30-23 lead at the break. Army shot no free throws for the game, the lowest total attempted or made in the history of the league tournament. Army's season low in both categories came against VMI on Nov. 21, when the team went 1-for-2 from the line. Bucknell hit 16-of-26 free throws for the game, forcing 17 turnovers and grabbing 15 steals.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.
